t: For the director of music. A psalm of David.
Blessed*pn are those who have regard for the weak; the*ld Lord*s delivers them in times of trouble.
The*ln Lord*s protects and preserves them— they*ld are counted among the blessed in the land— he*ld does not give them over to the desire of their foes.
The*ln Lord*s sustains them on their sickbed and*ld restores them from their bed of illness.
I*pn said, “Have mercy on me, Lord;*s heal*ld me, for I have sinned against you.”
My*ln enemies say of me in malice, “When*ld will he die and his name perish?”
When*ln one of them comes to see me, he*ld speaks falsely, while his heart gathers slander; then*ld he goes out and spreads it around.
All*pn my enemies whisper together against me; they*ld imagine the worst for me, saying,
“A*ln vile disease has afflicted him; he*ld will never get up from the place where he lies.”
Even*ln my close friend, someone*ld I trusted, one*ln who shared my bread, has*ld turned against me.
But*pn may you have mercy on me, Lord;*s raise*ld me up, that I may repay them.
I*ln know that you are pleased with me, for*ld my enemy does not triumph over me.
Because*ln of my integrity you uphold me and*ld set me in your presence forever.
Praise*pn be to the Lord,*s the God of Israel, from*ld everlasting to everlasting. Amen*lc and Amen.
